1.a: Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah were kings of Judah when the word of Yahweh came to Micah.
1.q: Who were the kings of Judah when the word of Yahweh came to Micah?

1.a: Yahweh will come down and tread on the pagan shrines on the earth.
1.q: On what will Yahweh come down and tread?

1.a: Yahweh will bring this judgment because of the rebellion of Jacob, and because of the sins of the house of Israel.
1.q: Why will Yahweh bring this judgment?

1.a: Samaria gathered carved figures, gifts, and idols from the gifts to her prostitution.
1.q: How did Samaria gather carved figures, gifts, and idols?

1.a: Micah lamented and wailed, and went barefoot and naked.
1.q: How did Micah express his grief over the sin of Israel and Jacob?

1.a: Beth Ezel mourned, for their protection was taken away.
Lachish was the beginning of sin for the daughter of Zion.
1.q: What city was the beginning of sin for the daughter of Zion?

1.a: They should shave their heads, for their children would go into exile from them.
1.q: Why should the Israelites shave their heads?

2.a: They are planning on their beds to do evil.
2.q: Where are people planning to do evil?

2.a: Yahweh will change the territory of the people, and remove it from them. So the rich people will have no descendants to divide up the territory.
2.q: Why will the rich people have no descendants to divide up the territory?

2.a: They strip the robe from those who pass by unsuspectingly.
2.q: From whom do Yahweh's people strip the robe?

2.a: They should get up and leave for this was not a place where they could stay, because of its uncleanness.
2.q: Why should Yahweh's people get up and leave?

2.a: Yahweh will gather the remnant of Israel.
2.q: Who will gather the remnant of Israel?

3.a: The leaders of Jacob eat the flesh of Yahweh's people.
3.q: Who eats the flesh of Yahweh's people?

3.a: Yahweh will hide his face from the leaders of Jacob because they have done evil deeds.
3.q: Why will Yahweh hide his face from the leaders of Jacob?

3.a: It will be dark so that the prophets will do no divination.
3.q: Why will the prophets do no divination?

3.a: The leaders judge for a bribe.
3.q: For what do the leaders judge?

4.a: In the last days the mountain of Yahweh's house will be established over the other mountains.
4.q: When will the mountain of Yahweh's house be established over the other mountains?

4.a: Many nations will want to go to the mountain of Yahweh, so he will teach them his ways, and they will walk in his paths.
4.q: Why will many nations want to go to the mountain of Yahweh?

4.a: All the peoples walk in the name of their god.
4.q: In what do all the peoples walk?

4.a: Yahweh will assemble the lame and gather the outcast, those whom he had afflicted.
The daughter of Zion will be rescued in Babylon.
4.q: Where will the daughter of Zion be rescued?

4.a: The nations do not know Yahweh's thoughts
4.q: According to the prophet, who does not know Yahweh's thoughts?

4.a: Yahweh will devote their unjust wealth to himself.
4.q: To whom will Yahweh devote many peoples' unjust wealth?

5.a: They will strike the leader of Israel with a rod on the cheek.
5.q: With what will the enemy strike the leader of Israel?

5.a: God will give them up, until the time when she who was in labor bears a child.
5.q: For how long will God give up the clans of Judah?

5.a: The child will shepherd his flock in the strength of Yahweh.
5.q: Who will shepherd his flock in the strength of Yahweh?

5.a: The remnant of Jacob do not wait for man.
5.q: For what do the remnant of Jacob not wait?

5.a: When the Israelites' hand is lifted against their enemies, it will destroy them.
5.q: What will happen when the Israelites' hand will be lifted against their enemies?

5.a: Yahweh will execute vengeance on the nations that have not listened.
5.q: On whom will Yahweh execute vengeance?

6.a: Yahweh will fight in court against Israel.
6.q: What will Yahweh do against Israel?

6.a: He commanded them to testify against him.
6.q: What did Yahweh command his people to do against him?

6.a: Yahweh required his people to act justly, love kindness, and walk humbly with their God.
6.q: What did Yahweh require from his people?

6.a: The tongue of the inhabitants who have spoken lies is deceitful.
Yahweh made the city a ruin because of his sins.
6.q: Why did Yahweh make the city a ruin?

6.a: The city walked by the advice of Omri and Ahab.
6.q: By whose advice did the city walk?

7.a: The godly man perished from the earth.
The watchmen foretold the day of the punishment of the remaining people.
7.q: Who foretold the day of the punishment of the remaining people?

7.a: A man's enemies are the people of his own house.
After Micah falls, he will rise.
7.q: What would happen after Micah falls?

7.a: Micah will bear Yahweh's rage until Yahweh pleaded his cause, and executed judgment for Micah.
7.q: For how long will Micah bear Yahweh's rage?

7.a: Micah's eyes will look at his enemy.
7.q: At whom will Micah's eyes look?

7.a: When a day comes to build the walls, the boundaries will be extended very far.
7.q: What will happen when a day comes to build the walls?

7.a: Micah asked Yahweh to shepherd his people with his rod.
7.q: How did Micah ask Yahweh to shepherd his people?
What will Yahweh show his people?

7.a: They will see and be ashamed of all their power.
7.q: What will the nations see and be ashamed of?

7.a: The nations will come to Yahweh and they will be afraid because of him.
7.q: Who will the nations come to and be afraid of?

7.a: Yahweh will not keep his anger forever, because he loves to show his covenant faithfulness.
7.q: Why will Yahweh not keep his anger anger forever?

7.a: Yahweh will throw all their sins into the depths of the sea.
7.q: Into what will Yahweh throw all the sins of the people of Israel?
